content.webTitle: Rick Perry's election evolution: versions 1.0 through 4.0 | Ana Marie Cox

fields.headline: Rick Perry's election evolution: versions 1.0 through 4.0
fields.bodyText: Rick Perry may think evolution is "a theory that's out there" and it's "got some gaps in it," but his movement from a can-do job-creating, armed criminal-killer to an earnestly tender-hearted fetus-defender is more than just a theory, and it has very few gaps. Here's a guide to his morph. Presidential Candidate Perry 1.0, August 2011 Typical facial expression: Squinty determination Take on Obama: Spendthrift pussy Key quote: "If this guy [Bernanke] prints more money between now and the election, I don't know what y'all would do to him in Iowa, but we would treat him pretty ugly down in Texas." Campaign ad highlights: "We will not sit back and accept our current misery...because a great country requires a better direction...because a renewed nation requires a new president." Tone of campaign ad voice over: Urgently conspiratorial Unofficial campaign slogan: "I can make America as awesome as Texas even if it means killing some people." Poll standing in IA: 3rd, 19% NH: 4th, 9.7% Perry 2.0, September 2011 Typical facial expression: Squinty inquiry as to what the question was, again Take on Obama: Gleeful traitor bent on America's destruction Key quote: Social security is a "monstrous lie." Unofficial campaign slogan: "Let me try that again." Campaign ad highlights: "A great country requires a better direction … The United States of America is the last great hope of mankind." Tone of campaign ad voice over: Apocalyptic Poll standing IA: 1st, 25% NH: 4th, 9.7% Perry 3.0, October 2011 Typical facial expression: Dazedly giddy Take on Obama: Foreign-born tree-hugging terrorist Key quote: "I'm a doer, not a talker." Unofficial campaign slogan: "I'm not as think as you drunk I am." Campaign ad highlights: "If you're looking for a slick politician or a guy with great teleprompter skills, we already have that, and he's destroying our economy." Tone of campaign ad voice over [by Rick Perry]: Jaunty! Poll standing IA: 6th, 7.2% NH: 2nd, 14.7% Perry 4.0, November 2011 Typical facial expression: Blank Take on Obama: Lazy America-hating rich kid Key quote: "Oops." Unofficial campaign slogan: "Comedy relief is still relief." Campaign ad highlights: "Can you believe that? That's what our president thinks is wrong with America? That Americans are lazy?" Tone of campaign ad voice over [by Rick Perry]: Incredulous! Poll standing IA: 6th, 6.3% NH: 6th 2.8% Perry 5.0, December 2011 Typical facial expression: Sweatily Christian. Take on Obama: Atheist vandal of the American dream Key quote: "I hope I am the Tim Tebow of the Iowa caucuses." Unofficial campaign slogan: "Praying for a miracle." Campaign ad highlights: "You don't need to be in the pew every Sunday to know there's something wrong in this country when gays can serve openly in the military but our kids can't openly celebrate Christmas or pray in school." Tone of campaign ad voice over [by Rick Perry]: Goofily devout Poll standing IA: 4th, 12% NH: 7th, 2%
